title: Your Thursday Briefing: China Eases Covid Restrictions
description: Also, Peru’s president is ousted and Germany arrests 25 people suspected of plotting a coup.

title: Read Your Way Through Kingston, Jamaica
description: “No one sound speaks for all” Jamaicans, the novelist Marlon James says. Here are the books he recommends for readers who want to see the island’s many facets.

title: U.S. Proposes Global Green Steel Club That Would Put Tariffs on China
description: A concept paper sent to the European Union suggests a new trade approach to promote metal made with less carbon emissions.

title: Indiana Sues TikTok for Security and Child Safety Violations
description: The lawsuits are the first by an American state against TikTok, which is owned by the Chinese company ByteDance, in a sign of mounting legal pressure.

title: Who Is Prince Heinrich XIII, a Man Accused of Trying to Overthrow Germany’s Government?
description: Descended from an ancient aristocratic family, Heinrich now stands accused of being a leader of a far-right plot to overthrow the German government.

title: John Kerry Plans to Meet With Biden to Discuss His Future as Climate Envoy
description: In an interview, Mr. Kerry said he would meet with the president next week to talk about “the road ahead.”

title: Morocco Win in World Cup Brings Celebration Across Africa and Middle East
description: Arabs and Africans around the world joined in an outpouring of pride and joy over Morocco’s World Cup success after it defeated Spain.

title: Peru’s President, Facing Impeachment, Says He Will Dissolve Congress
description: The president, Pedro Castillo, imposed a national curfew and said an emergency government would rule by decree. Critics said the president was staging a coup.

title: Sounds of War Mark Time in Bakhmut, in Eastern Ukraine
description: In Bakhmut, in eastern Ukraine, rumbles and blasts are just background noise, until they aren’t.

title: U.S. Recognition of Tiny Pacific Country Reshapes Its New Zealand Ties
description: The American move to recognize the Cook Islands as a sovereign state is evidence of how the U.S.-China competition is realigning Pacific politics.

title: A Failed Romance, Long Lockdowns and a Friend’s Suicide in India
description: During the height of the Covid pandemic, a friend was a precious lifeline, quick to help and hug, while struggling to reconcile himself to a relationship’s end.

title: Ukraine War: A Timeline of Attacks on Russian Territory
description: Ukraine has often celebrated the attacks, but has not officially confirmed involvement in any of them.

title: President Zelensky of Ukraine Is Time’s ‘Person of the Year’ 2022
description: Ukraine’s president was propelled onto the world stage with Russia’s invasion of his country.

title: China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Policy, in Pictures
description: Public unrest erupted across the country after years of disruptive restrictions. These photographs give a glimpse of life under those measures.

title: U.N. Catalogs Russian Killings Early in War
description: A detailed accounting of civilian deaths arises from one of several international investigations into the macabre scenes discovered after the Russian Army’s retreat from Kyiv.

title: China’s Protest Prophet
description: One man’s demands became the rallying cries for the country’s biggest demonstrations in a generation.

title: In Paris Then, in Kyiv Now, Visions of Freedom and Bravery
description: Our critic was engrossed by drawings from the French Revolution early in the year. Then Russia invaded Ukraine, and recast art in a hard new light.

title: India Chases Clean Energy, but Economic Goals Put Coal First
description: “I will not compromise on the availability of power,” India’s energy minister has declared in defense of fossil fuel use, which is heavily subsidized.

title: China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Policy Changes, Explained
description: The Chinese government ordered officials to cut back on mass testing and hair-trigger regional lockdowns, in a pivot from stringent pandemic rules.

title: Germany Arrests 25 People Suspected of Planning a Coup
description: Many of those detained had military training and were believed to belong to a recently formed group that operated on the conviction that the country was ruled by the so-called deep state.

title: How El Salvador’s State of Emergency Has Impacted the Crime Rate
description: The president declared a state of emergency eight months ago to take on gang violence, and arrests soared. Close to 100,000 people are behind bars as of November, more than triple the prison system’s capacity.

title: China Eases ‘Zero Covid’ Restrictions in Victory for Protesters
description: Beijing’s costly policy of lockdowns has pummeled the world’s second-largest economy and set off mass public protests that were a rare challenge to China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Donald Trump’s family company has been found guilty of tax fraud, a blow to the firm and the former president.

title: Russian Anti-War Activists Seek Common Goals (When They’re Not Bickering)
description: Almost 300 activists, many young and from the diaspora, gathered to try to forge a common path, beyond struggling against Vladimir Putin and the war in Ukraine.

title: Global Partners May End Broad Covid Vaccination Effort in Developing Countries
description: The board of Gavi, the international vaccine agency, meets Wednesday to debate shutting down the program, known as Covax, amid swiftly waning demand for the shots.

title: Corrections: Dec. 7, 2022
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Wednesday, Dec. 7, 2022.

title: US Court Dismisses Suit Against Saudi Crown Prince in Khashoggi Killing
description: The court followed the Biden administration’s guidance that Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has immunity as a head of government in a case over the death of Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Ukraine Strikes More Boldly, Seeing Little Room for Russia to Escalate
description: The third apparent drone attack in two days on a Russian air base indicates a new phase of the war for Ukraine as it develops longer-range weapons.
